Package io.github.ai4ci.functions

Interface LoessInterpolator

All Superinterfaces:
Interpolator, Serializable
@Immutable public interface LoessInterpolator extends Interpolator
Local regression (LOESS) interpolator for one-dimensional data.

Main purpose: provide a convenient, immutable wrapper around Apache Commons Math's LOESS implementation that fulfils the Interpolator contract. The implementation fits a smooth piecewise polynomial to the supplied (x,y) data and exposes interpolation and derivative evaluation.

Key features:

  • Immutable configuration via Immutables builder;
  • Automatic bandwidth selection based on sample size;
  • Provides both interpolated value and first derivative evaluation.

Downstream uses: consumed wherever a smooth local regression is required for numeric curves, for example in smoothing empirical profiles before fitting or calibration routines (see EmpiricalDistribution).

Author:
Rob Challen

  • Method Details

    • createLoessInterpolator

      static LoessInterpolator createLoessInterpolator(double[] x, double[] y)
      Construct a LOESS interpolator from the supplied data arrays.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinates (must be strictly increasing)
      y - the y-coordinates (same length as x)
      Returns:
      an immutable LoessInterpolator instance
      See Also:
      • Interpolator.checkInputs(double[], double[])

    • differential

      default double differential(double x)
      Compute the first derivative of the fitted LOESS spline at the point supplied. Values outside the fitted support are clamped to the support boundaries before evaluation.
      Specified by:
      differential in interface Interpolator
      Parameters:
      x - the point at which to evaluate the derivative
      Returns:
      the first derivative of the interpolant at x

    • getLoess

      @Lazy default org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.polynomials.PolynomialSplineFunction getLoess()
      Returns an evaluated polynomial spline function produced by the LOESS algorithm.

      Clients may use the returned PolynomialSplineFunction for advanced evaluation, for example to obtain higher order derivatives.

      Returns:
      the fitted PolynomialSplineFunction

    • getMaxSupport

      @Derived default double getMaxSupport()
      The maximum x value in the support of the interpolator.
      Returns:
      the maximum x value (domain upper bound)

      Returns:

    • getX

      double[] getX()

    • getY

      double[] getY()
      The dependent coordinate values used to fit the LOESS model.
      Returns:

    • interpolate

      default double interpolate(double x)
      Interpolate the fitted LOESS spline at the supplied point.

      Values outside the fitted support are clamped to the support boundaries to avoid extrapolation artefacts.

      Specified by:
      interpolate in interface Interpolator
      Parameters:
      x - the point at which to evaluate the interpolant
      Returns:
      the interpolated y value
